Package in.co.rays.proj4.controller

Class BaseCtl

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • in.co.rays.proj4.controller.BaseCtl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChangePasswordCtl, CollegeCtl, CollegeListCtl, CourseCtl, CourseListCtl, DoctorCtl, DoctorListCtl, ErrorCtl, FacultyCtl, FacultyListCtl, ForgetPasswordCtl, GetMarksheetCtl, LoginCtl, MarksheetCtl, MarksheetListCtl, MarksheetMeritListCtl, MyProfileCtl, PatientCtl, PatientListCtl, RoleCtl, RoleListCtl, StudentCtl, StudentListCtl, SubjectCtl, SubjectListCtl, TimetableCtl, TimetableListCtl, UserCtl, UserListCtl, UserRegistrationCtl, WelcomeCtl
    public abstract class BaseCtl
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    Author:
    Aniket Rajput BaseCtl is an abstract controller class that provides common functionality for all servlets in the project. It extends HttpServlet and includes constants, validation, preload, and DTO population methods.

    This class defines common operations such as Save, Update, Delete, etc., and provides mechanisms to:

    • Validate user input
    • Preload data before page load
    • Populate Beans from HttpServletRequest
    • Populate DTOs with audit fields like createdBy and modifiedBy

    All child controllers must extend this class and implement the getView() method to return the view (JSP) name associated with the controller.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        protected boolean validate​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Validates input data from the HttpServletRequest.

        Child classes can override this method to implement custom validation logic. Returns true if validation passes or nothing needs to be validated, otherwise false.

        Parameters:
        request - the HttpServletRequest object containing form data
        Returns:
        true if input is valid, false otherwise

      • preload

        protected void preload​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Preloads data required by the form before the page is loaded.

        Child classes can override this method to load dynamic (from database) or static (from JSP) data.

        Parameters:
        request - the HttpServletRequest object to set preloaded data

      • populateBean

        protected BaseBean populateBean​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Populates a BaseBean object with data from the HttpServletRequest.

        This method is typically overridden by child controllers to extract form data and populate the corresponding Bean object.

        Parameters:
        request - the HttpServletRequest object containing form data
        Returns:
        a BaseBean populated with request data, or null if no data

      • populateDTO

        protected BaseBean populateDTO​(BaseBean dto,
                               javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Populates common fields in the DTO like createdBy, modifiedBy, createdDateTime, and modifiedDateTime based on the request and session user.
        Parameters:
        dto - the BaseBean DTO to populate
        request - the HttpServletRequest object containing user/session info
        Returns:
        the populated DTO

      • service

        protected void service​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                       javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
                throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                       java.io.IOException
        Overrides the service method to perform tasks such as preloading and validation before processing requests.
        Overrides:
        service in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        Parameters:
        request - the HttpServletRequest object
        response - the HttpServletResponse object
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - if a servlet-specific error occurs
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • getView

        protected abstract java.lang.String getView()
        Abstract method that must be implemented by all child classes to return the JSP view name for the current controller.
        Returns:
        the name of the JSP view
